intro: Psychotria macrocalyx, commonly known as the "Great Leaf Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
